thing-type.label: ZMNHND Flush 1D relay
thing-type.description: Flush 1D relay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThis Z-Wave module is used for switching on or off the electrical device (e.g. light or fan). The module can be controlled either through Z-wave network or through the wall switch. The module is designed to be mounted inside a “flush mounting box”, hidden behind a traditional wall switch. Module measures power consumption of electrical device and supports connection of digital temperature sensor. It is designed to act as repeater in order to improve range and stability of Z-wave network. Supported switches Module supports mono-stable switches (push button) and bi-stable switches. The module is factory set to operate with bi-stable switches.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gt<b&gtModule Inclusion (Adding to Z-Wave network)</b&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtConnect module to power supply (with temperature sensor connected -if purchased)</li&gt <li&gtEnable add/remove mode on main controller</li&gt <li&gtAuto-inclusion (works forabout 5 seconds after connected to power supply) or</li&gt <li&gtPress push button I1 three times within 3s (3 times change switch state within 3 seconds) or</li&gt <li&gtPress service button <b&gtS</b&gt (only applicable for 24 V SELV supply voltage) for more than 2 seconds.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE1:</strong&gt For auto-inclusion procedure, first set main controller into inclusion mode and then connect module to power supply.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE2:</strong&gt When connecting temperature sensor to module that has already been included, you have to exclude module first. Switch off power supply , connect the sensor and re-include the module.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gt<b&gtModule Exclusion/Reset (Removing from Z-Wavenetwork)</b&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtConnect module to power supply</li&gt <li&gtBring module within maximum 1 meter (3 feet) of the main controller,</li&gt <li&gtEnable add/remove mode on main controller,</li&gt <li&gtPress push button <b&gtI1 </b&gtfive times within 3s (5 times change switch state within 3 seconds) in the first 60 seconds after the module is connected to the power supply or</li&gt <li&gtPress service button <b&gtS </b&gt(only applicable for 24 V SELV supply voltage) for more than 6 seconds.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtBy this function all parameters of the module are set to default values and own ID is deleted.</p&gt <p&gtIf push button I1 is pressed three times within 3s (or service button S is pressed more than 2 and less than 6 seconds) module is excluded, but configuration parameters are not set to default values.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
parameter.description: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtFlush 1D relay module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: Automatic turning off relay after set time
parameter.description: Automatic turning off relay after set time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen relay is ON it goes automatically OFF after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive ON command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: Automatic turning on relay after set time
parameter.description: Automatic turning on relay after set time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen relay is OFF it goes automatically ON after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive OFF command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Auto turn off / on seconds or milliseconds
parameter.description: Auto turn off / on seconds or milliseconds<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAutomatic turning off / on seconds or milliseconds selection.</p&gt <p&gtNOTE: Parameter is the same for turning OFF or ON.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_1
parameter.label: 30: Save state after power failure
parameter.description: Save state after power failure<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSaving the state of the relay after a power failure</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Do not save state after power failure

parameter.name: config_63_1
parameter.label: 63: Output Switch selection
parameter.description: Output Switch selection<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value means the type of the device that is connected to the output. The device type can be normally open (NO) or normally close (NC).</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Output 230V or 24V when system turned off

parameter.name: config_100_1
parameter.label: 100: Endpoint I2 Notification and Event
parameter.description: Endpoint I2 Notification and Event<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE 1</strong&gt: After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) then wait at least 30s and then re-include the module!</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE 2</strong&gt: When the parameter is set to value 9 the notifications are sent for Home Security. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_110_2
parameter.label: 110: Temperature sensor offset settings
parameter.description: Temperature sensor offset settings<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value is added to or subtracted from actual measured value by sensor. </p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt32536: offset is 0.0 °C</li&gt <li&gt1 to 100: value from 0.1 °C to 10.0 °C is added to actual measured temperature</li&gt <li&gt1001 to 1100: value from -0.1 °C to -10.0 °C is subtracted to actual measured temperature<br /&gt</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_120_1
parameter.label: 120: Digital temperature sensor reporting
parameter.description: Digital temperature sensor reporting<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0: Reporting disabled</li&gt <li&gt1- 127: 0,1°C - 12,7°C, step is 0,1°C</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Lifeline to Controller<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtLifeline group (reserved for communication with the main controller), 1 node allowed.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Basic ON/OFF
parameter.description: Basic ON/OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtBasic ON/OFF (triggered at change of the output state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Basic ON/OFF (I2)
parameter.description: Basic ON/OFF (I2)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtBasic ON/OFF (triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes. </p&gt

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: Binary Sensor Report
parameter.description: Binary Sensor Report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtBinary Sensor Report (triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: 5: Notification Report
parameter.description: Notification Report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtTriggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_6
parameter.label: 6: Multilevel Sensor Report
parameter.description: Multilevel Sensor Report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtTriggered at change of temperature sensor up to 16 nodes.</p&gt
